trans-unit.source: Represents a menu item inside a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu"></xref> control.
You typically use a RibbonApplicationMenuItem to invoke a command when the menu item is clicked.
For more information about using commands with menu items, see [How to: Add a Command to a MenuItem](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/013d68a0-5373-4a68-bd91-5de574307370).
A RibbonApplicationMenuItem can have submenus.
The submenu of the RibbonApplicationMenuItem is made up of the objects within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection of a RibbonApplicationMenuItem.
It is common for a RibbonApplicationMenuItem to contain other RibbonApplicationMenuItem objects to create nested submenus.
A RibbonApplicationMenuItem cannot have submenus and also invoke a command.
If the RibbonApplicationMenuItem has a submenu, the command associated with the RibbonApplicationMenuItem is not invoked.
When you need a control that acts as a menu header and invokes a command, use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationSplitMenuItem>.
The following illustration shows the Application Menu for a ribbon control.
The **Open**, **Save**, and **Page Setup** items are examples of the RibbonApplicationMenuItem control.
![Ribbon Application Menu](~/add/media/wpfribbon-appmenu.png "Ribbon Application Menu")
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem"></xref> class.
Returns a new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem"></xref> object.

A new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem"></xref> container object that is used to display an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items*> collection.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own container.
The item to test.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the item is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem"></xref>, a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationSplitMenuItem"></xref>, a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonSeparator"></xref>, or a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGallery"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates at what level the menu item is displayed.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
One the enumeration values that specifies at what level the menu item is displayed.
The registered default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItemLevel"></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem.Level*> dependency property.
To be added.
Called when the KeyTip or accelerator key is pressed.
Contains data about the activation.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem"></xref> when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
The event data.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
The element that is used to display the item.
The item to display from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items*> collection.

Returns a value that indicates whether to apply the style from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemContainerStyle*> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemContainerStyleSelector*> property to the container element of the specified item.
The container element.
The item that the container is for.
if container is a , , or ; otherwise, the value returned by the base implementation.
